intro: Myrobalanus punctata, commonly known as the punctate tamarind, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India, Sri Lanka, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves and clusters of small, reddish fruits. The fruits are typically used in traditional medicine and as a source of tannins. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
